attributes.action: sack Christine Green and the Directors of Tameside General Hospital
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tameside Hospital NHS Foundation Trust scored just 4.8 out of 100 for patient safety in the report by Dr Foster. It puts the hospital in the bottom 12 of more than 150 trusts in England and particularly points to the hospital’s death rate, which is the 3rd highest in the country. ASHTON MP David Heyes together with Tameside’s other MPs Andrew Gwynne & James Purnell, are now calling for an urgent meeting with government health secretary Andy Burnham to demand closer scrutiny of the hospital. Mr Heyes, whose constituency includes the Ashton hospital, said: “In my view, when things go wrong at a hospital the managers should be held to account." Tameside’s coroner John Pollard, who in 2006 branded the hospital ‘despicable and chaotic’ said he would like to help the hospital improve & supported the MP’s actions. He added: “There are enormous improvements that have taken place, but clearly according to Dr Foster there is still work to be done. I am saddened to hear the findings and I would endorse the views taken by the MPs and support the actions they are proposing.”

Gordon Brown, it is time for you to step in and take action, now!
